ch.usi.inf.lidr.merging
Class SAFE<U>

java.lang.Object
  ch.usi.inf.lidr.merging.SAFE<U>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResultsMerging, ScoreNormalization
public final class SAFE<U>
extends Object
implements ResultsMerging

SAFE results merging/score normalization algorithm. SAFE learns the transformation function between centralized document ranks and centralized document scores. Then this function is applied to source-specific ranks (1, 2, ...) to obtain corresponding normalized scores.

IMPORTANT: For this class to function correctly, its type U should be the same as the type T of the normalize(List) method.

Author:
Ilya Markov
See Also:
"Robust result merging using sample-based score estimates", Milad Shokouhi and Justin Zobel. ACM Transactions on Information Systems, 27:3, pages 1-29, 2009.

Field Detail

rankRatio

private double rankRatio
The rank ratio. This ratio means that if a document has a rank r_s in a sample, then it should have the rank r_c = (r_s - 0.5) * rankRatio in the original collection.

IMPORTANT: the rank ratio should be set using setRankRatio(double) every time before running normalization. If it is not set, the ratio of 1 is used.

See Also:
setRankRatio(double)

sampleScoredDocs

private List<ScoredEntity<U>> sampleScoredDocs
The ranked list of sample documents. This list is used as an additional evidence/training data for performing SAFE score normalization.

IMPORTANT: the list of sampled documents must be set for each query using setSampleDocuments(List) before running normalization.

See Also:
setSampleDocuments(List)

SAFE

Method Detail

setRankRatio

public void setRankRatio(double rankRatio)
Sets the rank ratio.

IMPORTANT: this method should be called every time before running normalization. By default, the ratio of 1 is used.

Parameters:
rankRatio - The rank ratio. Should be positive.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if rankRatio is not positive.
See Also:
rankRatio

setSampleDocuments

public void setSampleDocuments(List<ScoredEntity<U>> sampleScoredDocs)
Sets the ranked list of sample documents. Sample documents' scores must be calculated by one single scoring function for a given query. Moreover, the scores must be calculated within a centralized index of documents, sampled from all sources of information/search engines.

In other words, the following steps must be performed in order to obtain sampledDocs.

  1. Sample a number of documents from each source of information/search engine.
  2. Create a single index out of all these documents.
  3. Run a given query on this index.
  4. Wrap obtained results into a ranked list of ScoredEntity objects.
  5. Extract documents belonging to a particular source and pass them to this method.

IMPORTANT: this method must be invoked for each query before running normalization.

Parameters:
sampleScoredDocs - The ranked list of sample documents.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if sampledDocs is null.
See Also:
sampleScoredDocs

normalize

public <T> List<ScoredEntity<T>> normalize(List<ScoredEntity<T>> unnormScoredDocs)
IMPORTANT: setSampleDocuments(List) must and setRankRatio(double) should be invoked before performing normalization.

Specified by:
normalize in interface ScoreNormalization
Parameters:
unnormScoredDocs - The list of document scores to be normalized.
Returns:
The list of normalized document scores.
See Also:
ch.usi.inf.lidr.norm.ScoreNormalization#normalize(List>), setSampleDocuments(List), setRankRatio(double)

getRank2ScoreMapping

private <T> Map<Integer,Double> getRank2ScoreMapping(List<ScoredEntity<U>> sampledDocs,
                                                     List<ScoredEntity<T>> scoredDocs)
For sample documents in sampledDocs calculates the correspondence between their estimated centralized ranks (based on rankRatio) and centralized scores. If a document from sampledDocs appears also in scoredDocs then its true rank is used.

getOverlapDocs

private <T> int getOverlapDocs(List<ScoredEntity<U>> sampledDocs,
                               Map<T,Integer> scoredDocRanks,
                               Map<Integer,Double> rank2score)
For each sample document in sampledDocs searches for a corresponding document in the source-specific list scoredDocRanks. If the correspondence is found, the true document rank is mapped to a centralized score.

Note the following situation. Let sampledDocs[i] and sampledDocs[j] have corresponding documents in scoredDocRanks. Then all sample documents between i and j are skipped and are not used as training data! This is because it is impossible to estimate their source-specific ranks.

Returns the index of the last sample document that has a correspondence in a source-specific list scoredDocRanks.

Returns:
The index of the last overlapping sample document.

getNonoverlapDocs

private <T> void getNonoverlapDocs(List<ScoredEntity<T>> sampledDocs,
                                   int lastSeenIndex,
                                   int offset,
                                   Map<Integer,Double> rank2score)
For each sample document starting from lastSeenIndex estimates its source-specific rank according to the following formula: r_c = offset + (r_s - 0.5) * rankRatio.

getDoc2RankMap

private <T> Map<T,Integer> getDoc2RankMap(List<ScoredEntity<T>> scoredDocs)
Transforms scoredDocs into a mapping between documents and their ranks.

getRegressions

private SAFE.Regression[] getRegressions(Map<Integer,Double> rank2score)
Creates a number of regressions and fills them with data from rank2score.

getRegressions

private SAFE.Regression[] getRegressions()
Returns four different regression models, namely, linear, log, square root and inverse linear.

getBestFitRegression

private SAFE.Regression getBestFitRegression(SAFE.Regression[] regressions)
Finds a regression with the highest Pearson's r coefficient among given regressions.

reset

private void reset()
Resets rankRatio and sampleScoredDocs.

See Also:
